column4: Google to shut down social networking service Orkut in September
column5: SAN FRANCISCO Google Inc will shut down its early social-networking service  Orkut  which was launched ten years ago but has failed to put Google ahead in what has become one of the Web's most popular businesses.

column4: EU's Almunia says could probe Google's YouTube dominance
column5: LONDON Europe's antitrust chief said on Monday he could investigate Google's YouTube if he saw any attempt by the company to abuse its dominant position in online video searching.

column4: U.S. top court rejects Google bid to drop Street View privacy case
column5: WASHINGTON  June 30 The U.S. Supreme Court on Monday rejected Google Inc's bid to dismiss a lawsuit accusing it of violating federal wiretap law when it accidentally collected emails and other personal data while building its popular Street View program.

column4: EU's Almunia says could probe Google's YouTube dominance

column4: US STOCKS-Futures dip modestly  but quarter set to end positive
column5: NEW YORK  June 30 U.S. stock index futures were slightly lower on Monday ahead of business activity and home sales data  with the S&P 500 and Nasdaq Composite indexes set to close a sixth straight quarter of gains - a streak not seen in more than 14 years.

column5: BOSTON Microsoft Corp  launched what it hopes will be the most successful private effort to date to crack down on cyber crime by moving to disrupt communications channels between hackers and infected PCs.

column5: LONDON  June 30 Shire  which is being pursued by U.S. drugmaker AbbVie in a $46 billion takeover attempt  said on Monday it had received a $248 million cash refund from the Canadian revenue authorities.

column4: Carlyle  TPG's Healthscope listing extends Australian IPO boom
column5: SYDNEY U.S. private equity giants TPG Capital and Carlyle Group  aim to raise up to A$2.57 billion ($2.42 billion) by listing Australian hospital operator Healthscope Ltd  in what is shaping up as the country's third-largest initial public offering.

column4: AT&T expands board to 14  appoints Glenn Hutchins as member
column5: June 30 AT&T Inc will expand its board of directors to 14 members from 13 and has appointed Glenn Hutchins  a member of the Federal Reserve Bank of New York's board of directors  to fill the new vacancy  the company said on Monday.

column4: MOVES-BofA names Jeremy Murphy MD for consumer  retail investment banking
column5: June 30 Bank of America Corp named Jeremy Murphy managing director in its Americas consumer and retail investment banking group  the bank said in an internal memo seen by Reuters.

column4: Exclusive: Jury awards $8.1 million to investor who alleged BB&T misled him
column5: A jury in a South Carolina state court on Monday awarded $8.1 million to a former adviser who sold his wealth management business to BB&T Corp and later alleged that the bank mismanaged his retirement nest egg with a risky strategy  according to a person familiar with the matter.

column4: BlackRock ETFs near $1 trillion as it loses market share to Vanguard
column5: NEW YORK Even as BlackRock Inc  is set to amass $1 trillion in exchange-traded fund assets in its iShares business  U.S. retail investors increasingly prefer to send their money to low-cost leader Vanguard Group  highlighting a weak spot for the world's biggest money manager.

column4: UPDATE 3-Abu Ghraib torture lawsuit revived by U.S. appeals court
column5: June 30 A federal appeals court has revived a lawsuit against CACI International Inc by four former Iraqi detainees who claimed the U.S. defense contractor's employees directed their torture at the Abu Ghraib prison near Baghdad.

column4: U.S. court revives Abu Ghraib detainees' torture case
column5: June 30 A federal appeals court on Monday revived a lawsuit against  CACI International Inc in which the defense contractor's employees were accused of directing the torture of detainees at the Abu Ghraib prison near Baghdad.

column4: Fitch Affirms Coventry Building Society's Mortgage Covered Bonds at 'AAA'; Outlook Stable
column5: (The following statement was released by the rating agency) LONDON  June 30 (Fitch) Fitch Ratings has affirmed Coventry Building Society's  (CBS  A/Stable/F1) GBP3.2bn mortgages covered bonds at 'AAA' with a Stable  Outlook. KEY RATING DRIVERS The covered bond rating is based on CBS's Long-term Issuer Default Rating (IDR)  of 'A'  an IDR uplift of 0  an unchanged Discontinuity Cap (D-Cap) of 4  (moderate risk) and the 78.4% asset percentage (AP) that Fitch takes into  account in its analysis. column4: Bombardier wins order for up to 24 regional jets

column4: DEALS-Global M&A at seven-year high as big corporate deals return
column5: NEW YORK  June 30 Investor support for large acquisitions and a desire to trump rivals in consolidating markets have led chief executives to strike big transactions so far in 2014  raising year-to-date global deal volumes to their highest level in seven years.

column4: WRAPUP 1-GM's ignition-switch crisis deepens; death toll rises to 16
column5: DETROIT  June 30 General Motors Co's  ongoing safety crisis over deadly ignition switches deepened on Monday with the recall of 8.23 million mostly older cars linked by the U.S. automaker to three deaths.

column4: GM victims' fund for ignition defect to have wide eligibility
column5: The compensation fund for victims of General Motors Co's  defective ignition switch in 2.6 million cars will award families of those who died as a result at least $1 million  the attorney in charge of the fund said on Monday. But victims injured in an additional 8.23 million cars recalled by GM for a similar problem on Monday will not be eligible.

column4: GM victims fund to have wide eligibility
column5: The compensation fund for victims of General Motors Co's  defective ignition switch will be open to a broad range of people  with family members of those who died as a result eligible for at least $1 million  the attorney in charge of the fund said on Monday.

column4: Morgan Stanley gives tweeting brokers some leeway
column5: NEW YORK Morgan Stanley is further opening the social media door for its brokers by allowing them to post self-authored content on firm-approved Twitter accounts.

column4: Morgan Stanley gives tweeting brokers some leeway
column5: NEW YORK  June 30 Morgan Stanley is further opening the social media door for its brokers by allowing them to post self-authored content on firm-approved Twitter accounts.

column4: Peru governor to seek re-election  fight gold project from prison
column5: LIMA  June 30 The jailed governor of a mineral-rich region in Peru who helped derail Newmont's $5 billion Conga gold project will run for re-election on an anti-mining ticket this year from prison  his party said on Monday.

column4: Oracle targets US$10bn debt raise with new bond
column5: NEW YORK  June 30 (IFR) - Oracle Corp on Monday launched a US$10 billion seven-part bond offering to finance its pending acquisition of Micros Systems and potential share buybacks as it looks to boost growth.

column4: Deals of the day- Mergers and acquisitions
column5: (Adds Devon Energy  Club Mediterranee  Woolworths  Isle of Capri Casinos  Fresenius  Meyer Werft  Puma; updates PPG Industries)

column4: U.S. chemicals maker PPG to buy Mexico's Comex for $2.3 billion
column5: MEXICO CITY U.S. chemicals maker PPG Industries Inc  said on Monday it had agreed to buy paints maker Consorcio Comex SA de CV for $2.3 billion after the Mexican company's deal to sell to U.S. rival Sherwin-Williams Co  fell through.

column4: UPDATE 3-U.S. chemicals maker PPG to buy Mexico's Comex for $2.3 bln
column5: * Deal will help PPG expand paints offering in Mexico  Central America

column4: Coatings maker PPG Industries to buy Mexico's Comex for $2.3 bln
column5: June 30 Coatings maker PPG Industries Inc  said it would buy Mexico-based Consorcio Comex SA de CV  an architectural and industrial coatings company  for $2.3 billion.

column4: Obama to nominate former P&G CEO Bob McDonald as veterans secretary
column5: WASHINGTON President Barack Obama has chosen former Procter & Gamble Chief Executive Bob McDonald  an Army veteran  as his nominee to be the next secretary of veterans affairs  a senior Obama administration official said on Sunday. | Video

column4: UPDATE 2-Poland short-lists Raytheon  Thales in missile system tender
column5: * Poland choosing operational systems over advanced technology   (Recasts  updates with statement from losing consortium)

column4: CORRECTED-Poland shortlists Thales/MBDA and Raytheon for missile defence system
column5: (Corrects headline and paragraph one to make clear two parties shortlisted)

column4: Turkey extends deadline for bids in missile defence tender - source
column5: ANKARA  June 30 Turkey has extended by two months the deadline for a French-Italian partnership and U.S. companies' bids in a tender for a long-range missile defence system  a source familiar with the matter told Reuters on Monday.

column5: MEXICO CITY U.S. chemicals maker PPG Industries Inc  said on Monday it had agreed to buy paints maker Consorcio Comex SA de CV for $2.3 billion after the Mexican company's deal to sell to U.S. rival Sherwin-Williams Co  fell through.

column4: Sony says only "natural disaster" could keep TVs in red this year
column5: TOKYO Only a "natural disaster" could keep Sony Corp's  TV division from returning to profit this year  the head of the newly independent business said on Monday  after a decade in the red and repeated missed promises of a turnaround.

column4: UPDATE 2-Sony says only "natural disaster" could keep TVs in red this year
column5: * Sony TV can make profit even if sales miss target - exec

column4: Sony confident TV business will swing to profit this year -exec
column5: TOKYO  June 30 Sony Corp is confident its struggling TV division will move into the black in the current financial year  even if it falls short of its volume sales target  the head of the TV unit said on Monday.

column4: Activist Peltz builds up $1 billion stake in BNY Mellon
column5: June 30 Activist investor Nelson Peltz has built up a $1 billion stake in BNY Mellon Corp in what could lead to a shakeup over lagging stock performance and rising operating expenses at the world's largest custody bank.

column4: BRIEF-Taiwan's TSMC orders machinery equipment for T$3.69 bln
column5: June 30 Taiwan Semiconductor Manufacturing Co Ltd

column4: Blackstone's new hedge fund involves independent companies-WSJ
column5: June 29 A direct investing initiative that Blackstone Group LP is working on in its hedge funds group involves independent management companies  the Wall Street Journal reported on its website on Sunday  citing people familiar with the plans.

column4: Market Chatter- Corporate finance press digest
column5: June 30 The following corporate finance-related stories were reported by media:

column4: REFILE-UPDATE 1-TreeHouse Foods to buy Flagstone Foods for $860 mln
column5: (Corrects to "Gryphon Investors" from "Gryphon Investor" in paragraph 9)

column4: TreeHouse Foods to buy Flagstone Foods for $860 mln
column5: June 30 Pickle maker TreeHouse Foods Inc  said it will buy Flagstone Foods  a maker of private-label health snacks  for $860 million from Gryphon Investors.

column4: Twitter rolls out app-install ads globally
column5: SAN FRANCISCO  June 30 Twitter Inc  began rolling out app-install ads globally on Monday  expanding a mobile advertising format that has proven successful on rival platforms such as Facebook.

column4: U.S. Bank in $200 million deal over mortgage lending violations
column5: U.S. Bank  a part of U.S. Bancorp  will pay $200 million to resolve allegations that it certified home loans for government insurance even though they did not meet regulatory requirements  the U.S. Justice Department said.

column4: UPDATE 1-U.S. Bank in $200 mln deal over mortgage lending violations
column5: June 30 U.S. Bank  a part of U.S. Bancorp   will pay $200 million to resolve allegations that it certified home loans for government insurance even though they did not meet regulatory requirements  the U.S. Justice Department said.

column4: U.S. Bank in $200 mln deal over mortgage lending violations
column5: WASHINGTON  June 30 U.S. Bank will pay $200 million to resolve allegations that it certified home loans for government insurance even though they did not meet requirements  the U.S. Justice Department said on Monday.

column4: BRIEF-Taiwan's UMC orders equipment from Applied Materials for T$770.8 mln
column5: * Says orders equipment from Applied Materials for T$770.8 million ($25.82 million)

column4: Paulson's Credit Opportunities fund up 6.6 percent ytd to end-May: source
column5: NEW YORK Hedge fund manager John Paulson's credit opportunities and merger arbitrage funds were up 6.6 percent and 3.3 percent year-to-date through the end of May  respectively  easily surpassing their benchmarks  according to an investor in attendance at Paulson & Co's recent mid-year client event.

column4: Allergan says U.S. FDA delays Semprana decision  OKs Ozurdex
column5: Allergan Inc said on Monday the U.S. Food and Drug Administration had raised issues about its application for a new acute migraine aerosol but had separately approved a treatment for diabetic macular edema.
